description: This tool refers to a recovery tools partition that is recommended to be placed immediately after the Windows partition. This placement allows Windows to modify and recreate the partition subsequently if future updates necessitate a larger recovery image. It is essential for system administrators to configure this partition correctly to enable seamless recovery and ensure that future updates can be accommodated without issues. Proper configuration of the recovery tools partition plays a crucial role in system stability and recovery efficacy. For detailed instructions on configuring this partition, refer to the relevant documentation provided by Microsoft.
